feed.subtitle: The latest updates from Emma's website

entry.title: A Bad Dream
entry.summary: Collage Poem. In which you are interrogated by the first-year members of Congress.
entry.content:
Transcription

A Bad Dream

You are sitting in a hard chair at a desk with good lighting.
You have been asked to speak to the first-year
Congresspeople.
You tell them that you don't remember
the presentation material.
The first-year members of Congress ask you
"Why Don't More People Wear Velcro Shoes?"
You realize that you don't have enough information
to answer the question.
You tell them
a humorous quote: "Teaching a parrot the
phrase supply and demand does not make it an
economist."
You are asked to elaborate on your answer.
You reveal to these first-year members of
Congress that you believe Shrek II is the glue that holds
economics together.
Still another Congressperson asks, "Were you awake during class?"
You smile and say that you were
playing the online game Second Life.
Instead of thanking you immensely for your remarks,
the first-year members of Congress come running after you.
Hint: You should run

More collage poetry

entry.title: Goblin Time
entry.summary: Collage Poem. A request for charitable donations in honor of #goblinWeek.
entry.content:
Transcription

goblin time

It's time to talk about goblins.
You know, a little wild, a little green,
kind of like Muppets?

Well, they need your help.

Goblins in our community
are suffering, exhausted by the internet,
and want to snuggle in for their holiday hibernation.

Your support is crucial in helping
provide them with year-round access to their daily needs:

  • Cuppa joe
  • weird radish Waffle
  • a cedarwood candle

Please donate today. All gifts are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.

  • $15 can help feed and vaccinate a goblin
  • $25 can purchase them a cozy flannel nightie
  • $50 can help them receive a lot of weird new bugs
Any amount helps!

Wrap a bit of cash in brown paper
and place it in ANY garden on a crisp morning...
we'll find it.

More collage poetry

entry.title: You're Invited
entry.summary: Collage Poem. An invitation to an innovative Secret Santa exchange.
entry.content:
Transcription

You're invited.

You can join our secret Santa® program.
This is a free program offered by "Granny"

How it works
Sign up online with your phone number
in as little as 30 seconds.
Then upload your biometric info
and a few selfies

You'll get paired with a real, human person
in the Chicago area.

You'll love your new online friend
So every year around the holidays, you are encouraged to
shower your friend with presents

Can't figure out what to get?
We give you quick, easy access to
personal information, financial information, credit report, or health information
so you can find an age- and gender-appropriate holiday gift.
The perfect present is something that feels
eerily personalized

Your gift will help someone to have
a magic surprise this holiday season.
So, join now!

*IMPORTANT! We do not receive funding from Kevin McCallister

entry.title: Alert
entry.summary: Collage Poem. An important warning and a sales pitch.
entry.content:
Transcription

Alert

Trees kinda moving?
Vegetation cozying up to your home?
Hearing speech when you touch the branches?

Don't just go about your day
Immediately get our FREE* 24/7 Cloud streaming video doorbell!

Action required if:

  • you're worried about A SCAM
  • you feel stress about DISPUTES
  • you see a BALLOON

No action required if:

  • you're Valid

Rest assured, we want to help
When you need it most
in every possible way.

FREE your homes
FREE your lives
FREE your fingertips

Call to claim offer.

DO NOT DISCARD

*$850

entry.title: Bears have adjectives
entry.summary: Collage Poem. An important PSA about bears.
entry.content:
Transcription

Please read!
Bears have adjectives,
Sun-drenched
transporting, hypnotically beautiful
Magnificent
Glowing!
in a floral state of mind
pretty
Uncondemned
of cosmic proportions!

More collage poetry

entry.title: VI. — A counterexample
entry.summary: Collage Poem. Basically sci-fi flash fiction masquerading as a logical proof.
entry.content:
Transcription

VI. — A counterexample

Let us pause to summarize our situation.
In 1950, physicist Enrico Fermi wondered why, if there is intelligent life in the universe, we haven't seen any evidence. In 1975, Michael Hart explored this question more deeply in writing.
One can, of course, formulate similar theorems based on other results above.

Proposition 3.6 — Suppose
Human perception is still easily fooled.
Then
All that's truly needed is time, patience and clear tape.
Proof. — The proof is essentially just that Dr. Whitman's published work is little more than "ancient astronaut" drivel.

This is, of course, parallel to a basic theme in the theory of
How We See the Sky.
However,
The basic questions tugged at me:
What is Education?
What Did the Romans Know?
Why Iowa?

For the analysis of amenable actions of other groups, we will need the following lemma.
Lemma 5.8. — Apparently Jim is not Jim.
Proof. — The reader should
CHECK YOUR OTHER LEFT POCKET

entry.title: What makes you feel better
entry.summary: Collage Poem. A non-linear, non-comprehensive list of Good Things.
entry.content:
Transcription

(grey outline of a person with a speech bubble) "What makes you feel better - more grounded - when you're losing yourself?"
1. Find a friend (illustration of person carrying a small white dog)
(goose encircled by a series of "honk"s)
Cat (photo of an orange cat rearing up on hind legs)
Shake it! (illustration of a woman in evening dress dancing and pulling her face away from her head, while a man looks at her with a disturbed expression)
Saving a ghost (a pink ghostly hand reaches out to a howling dog)
Under the sky (a woman sings and a man looks out over a lake)
